Through deep understanding of the data from every corner of the world, we can not only make better predictions and conclusions, but also fill in gaps in our knowledge, and even find answers to questions we hadn’t even thought of yet.

In my opinion, we are so lucky to live in such an age. The opportunities to take the big data and do data analytics to improve all aspects of our lives are also growing exponentially. As said by Joseph Sirosh, Microsoft’s recently elevated vice president, we are in a new era, the age of data. The fundamental transformations are being driven by the evolution of data analysis and intelligence from data. This is the age of the data professional.

We are in an information explosion society, which result in huge amount of data. The data is so valuable that kinds of useful information hide behind it. The information can be used for various purposes, like commercial, educational and so on. Data analysis technology aims to mine the valuable information from raw data to help understand what people need and want. As a matter of fact, data analysis can improve quality of life and make our life more convenient.

The important role of Data analysis in the Information Age is no doubt,  and big data analysis has wide application prospects. I think the data analysis will change our lives, through data analysis, we will be able to clearly understand of our world.

The era of big data brings numerous opportunities, but at the same time the privacy rights of individuals or institutions is likely to be hit. Big data contain a variety of personal information data and they are controlled by some Internet giant. However, these companies may collect data without the users’ permission, so in fact  it’s illegal to do like this. Therefore, in the era of big data, we should show more respect for the users’ personal rights.

articles.content: We can easily crawl original data from websites with different instruments, at the mean time we need classify these data into different types. There are two types of techniques used mostly, and they are supervised learning and unsupervised learning.The input trained are different from two learning techniques. For supervised learning, it processes on the input and the desired output from former instances, and predict the output of other new input resources according to the pattern of the former training data. Processor need to train dataset beforehand with this method.And for unsupervised learning, it don’t need the output of some instances, however, data classifier will group the input data into different clusters. Take this for example, for the first input, it will mark it with a cluster label A, and the subsequent input data will group into a new cluster B if they are not similar with the first cluster, otherwise, they will group into the same cluster.

articles.content: “Zhihu” is a Chinese Q&A website launched in Jan 2011. It’s a social media, focus on delivering the information to the users instead of providing a platform for people to chat with each other.As its initial launch, Zhihu offered a similar functionality as well as interface as Quora(which is a little more than a year launched before Zhihu). Some people have an opinion that Zhihu copied Quora. But even it’s true, it’s only a technology copy but not a high quality content and answers copy. Both of these two websites provide features as the following: (1) Voting the contents that you like; (2) Following the topics or users; (3) Replying the questions that you have interest in; (4) Sharing the contents to a third party; (5) Searching your interesting topics by organized articles and so on.Different from Quora, Zhihu is more like a community encouraging people to read, to learn or share their own experience while Quora is more like to provide some useful methods to solve the questioners’ problems. And in Zhihu, the first thing to do as a new user is to follow some famous user(“V-user”, who has large amount of follows and has lots of voting contents).After opening its gate by 2013, Zhihu are gaining more and more success these years. I cannot deny that the opening enrollment method had brought tons of joke answers on Zhihu so far, but there are still many a lot of good answers on Zhihu and more will be in the future. And I think with the growth of Intelligence of Chinese people, more and more good contents will getting more voting in the future, and for the negative ones, people will gradually rid them away.

comments.content: I am also a user of Zhihu and I personally think that Zhihu has three striking characteristics. First of all, there are two kinds of user in Zhihu: user who is brilliant (or professional) and user who pretends he is brilliant (or professional). Secondly, there are two kinds of answer in Zhihu: one is professional and the other is “one sentence witness” (in Chinese, we call it “抖机灵”). However, the general quality of answers is quite impressive. Finally, the users in Zhihu really like foreigners and it is easy for a foreigner to rack up a lot of followers without too much effort. For example, many foreigner users such as ‘Negar Kordi’, ‘佐藤谦一’and ‘谭蔓茹’ are now very popular in Zhihu and have become the internet celebrities in China. Well, what I said before is just a joke. However, I do think the prospect of Zhihu is optimistic and I will continue to support this interesting platform.

articles.title: Do you know about Zhihu？

articles.content:
Sentiment Classification is a polarity detection for classifying an opinion document and estimate the polarity of opinions of the writer. One of the the approach is using dictionary to store same keywords score such as like =1 , bad = -1 etc and estimate the polarity by estimate the score each sentence has for classification.Using dictionary-based approach, we need to create dictionaries that store specific words with scores. Using these dictionary, we can get a normalised score for each sentence. Then, we can classify this sentence as positive, negative or neutral.
For example, dictionary = {like:+1,bad:-1, worth:+1, boring,-1}
I like this movie => score =+1 => positive
This coffee taste bad => score=-1 =>negative
This movie is boring but still worth to watch it =>score = 0 =>neutral
articles.title: Sentiment Classification

articles.content:
K-Means Clustering is a method to divide data in groups. It is done by comparing the similarity of each data point with sampling points. Then it performs a recursive process for finding means of each group to perform the next clustering process. It is a easy way to carry out unsupervised learning.
However, as K-Means Clustering does not have a fixed solution. The comparison of similarity can be done with getting different features. Thus, the accuracy for clustering can be enhanced with getting suitable features of the data set.
Another classification method is Naive Bayes Text Classification. This classification method classifies the text by calculating the possibility that words belong to a group. The accuracy is also the problem to enhance.
articles.title: K-Means Clustering and Naive Bayes Text Classification

articles.content: By analysing of information from the Internet with machine learning, we can get different kind of useful data .Machine Learning can be divided into two types.Supervised learning is to predict the output from the new given input by a trained program with some training data. For example, we can classify whether the person is male or female in an image by a trained program with using SVM.Unsupervised learning is to classify the data in define different cluster without knowing the output initially. For example, we can group books with similar text into same cluster without training data like k-means clustering.With these machine learning algorithms, we can undergo different type of analysis in a easier way.

The dictionary-based method is an obvious advantage of Weibo Mood Analysis, even Oxford Dictionary released  emoticon “Cried with Smile” as the 2015 annual word.In the end of this blog, I will put a picture of U.S. Mood Throughout the Day inferred from Twitter to show how clearly Twitter and Weibo Mood expressed our life. articles.content: In lecture 5, we learn about Sentiment Analysis. This lecture let me think about the users’ comment about products on Amazon. Every sold product on Amazon is an entity, and every user’s comment contribute to the Attributes, as simply as the user’s rating. Positive feedback is 5-4 rating, neutral feedback is 3 rating and negative feedback is 2-1 rating.But when users contribute negative feedback, what will Amazon do? Amazon customer services will judge the accountability of feedback in clam, find is it company wrong or customer’s malicious feedback. And every negative feedback has a RESOLVE button, click RESOLVE can analysis specific programs of solving negative feedbacks.Amazon establish the negative feedback incentives, each servicer solving a feedback, give the clerk some reward. For example, after solving a feedback about poor quality of products, servicer can reward 50 yuan. They promote sales and improve management rating by these incentives. Amazon encourages sellers and buyers to consult removing negative feedback, it will unhelpful to sentiment analysis, but good at products sales.

comments.content: Obviously, Amazon is very smart. Amazon knows how to use sentiment analysis to help in building a great Attributes which is very helpful to enhance their products’ competences. Based on the users’ feedback no matter good or bad, they will give review on that. Good feedback is, of course, good but bad feedback is also good for their improvements on service and products sales.

I never contribute a negative feedback on Amazon and I didn’t know that Amazon has negative feedback incentives. It sounds so cool. I have contributed several negative feedbacks on Taobao. And Taobao sellers would do everything they can to remove the negative feedback. So sentiment analysis of user’s comment about products on Taobao is incredible.

In my opinion, adopting incentives measures really improves the whole quality of the Amazon platform. Though buyers and sellers can resolve the bad feedback, they might record their reasons on the comments. So I think that for sentiment analysis, it can collect more information from this platform and the analysis result will be more convincing. Or maybe I misunderstand the detail of the process of Amazon’s measures?

like another classmate mentioned above,  the sentiment analysis on TaoBao is more complex than Amazon, some sellers buy many good comments, it is impossible that lots of products have good comments more than 95%, and no bad comments, make customer hard to believe. and  another different is that The Resolve function in Amazon is a official way to solve dispute.

I agree with your opinion that the reviews of many ecommerce platforms would mislead the sentiment analysis in some degree. I once bought a cloth online, when i receive the cloth, i found it had many flaws so i gave a negative feedback. Then the shop owner make persistent phone call to me in order to persuade me withdraw the negative feedback. This might be good to their product sales, but it could mislead the sentiment analysis while most of the negative feedbacks are withdrawed or turned into positive feedback. So i think the ecommerce platforms such as Amazon, Taobao, etc. should enhance the supervision and present the real sentiment result of customers on their platforms.

articles.title: Amazon’s incentives will affect the Sentiment Analysis

articles.content: In the lecture seven, we reviewed some knowledge that we have learned last term about closeness, centrality and degree. All of these are basic definition of social networking analysis, so we need to learn it well to have a better understanding of social network analysis.We learned that there two dimensions for information flow processes within a social network, one is transmission dimension and the other is trajectory dimension. The transmission dimension distinguishes whether diffusion occurs via transfer or replication, and trajectory dimension concerns whether the traffic flows non-deterministically. Four different kinds of trajectories are classified according to their features, they are geodesics, paths, trails, and walks.

articles.content: We learned different levels of sentiment analysis in lecture 6. Document—level and sentence—level classification have limitations. They attempt to detect the overall polarity of a sentence, or text span, but do not return what people liked and disliked about an entity or some aspects of the entity. Thus, we need aspect—level analysis to identify the aspects of target entities and the sentiment expressed towards a specific aspect.  Aspect—level analysis consists of the following tasks.Aspect term extraction: Given a set of sentences with pre-identified entities, identify the aspect terms present in the sentence and return a list containing all the distinct aspect terms.Aspect term polarity: Given a set of aspect terms within a sentence, determine whether the polarity of each aspect term is positive, negative, neutral or conflict.Aspect category detection: Given a predefined set of aspect categories, identify the aspect categories discussed in a given sentence.Aspect category polarity: Given a set of pre-identified aspect categories, determine the polarity of each aspect category.

articles.content: To describe the importance of entities in social network, there’s a new method called entropy centrality apart from measurements like closeness, betweenness, degree and etc we’ve learnt last term.It means the probability the flow stops at each other node if starting at a specific one. When entropy centrality of the starting entity is high, then nodes on the flow seem to stop at anywhere with equal probability so that it’s difficult to predict the destination of flow. Otherwise, if entropy centrality of it is relative low, the probabilities of each node being the end of flow have quite large differences.Conversely, when the probability of each node seems to be equal or has few distinction in one network, the entropy centrality of the beginning of it seems to be high. And one network with maximum of entropy centrality will told to be with maximum of centrality(e.g. star network).

articles.content: Entropy centrality was introduced by Tutzauer in 2007 as a measure of centrality for networks characterized by path-based transfer flows. As most of the centrality measures before 2005 focused on either parallel duplication or geodesics, Tutzauer’s methods seemed quite different. Because of basis on Shannon’s information theory,  it was named “entropy” centrality. In Shannon’s information theory, information can be measured by uncertainty, or entropy, it indicates the amount of randomness or range of choice, if there is much randomness and plenty of choice, then information is high. Information in a system can be described in a mathematic method by this formula: H = – ∑( pi)(log pi), that is related to transmitted symbols’ probability pi.

comments.content: In the information age, we need a proper measuring standard for information so that it makes data analysis easier. The information entropy is the standard for us to measure information. As what you say, when choices are highly constrained, the entropy centrality is low.And this means it’s more easier to predict certain symbols. On the contrary, if the entropy centrality is high, prediction is difficult.

articles.content: Content analysis is a technique aiming to extract deep meaning from the surface information. Generally speaking, it can cover both human and computer techniques. The two techniques have their own advantages and disadvantages respectively. For computer techniques, it offers high reliability for it can  guarantee the consistency of the results and reproducibility, same input always produces same output. What’s more, if there are a huge number of contents to be analyzed, only depending on human techniques is obviously not realistic. However, human techniques can provide more qualitative analysis by using techniques like abstract reasoning which is exactly the limit of computer techniques. Without their own logic and thought, computer techniques highly rely on mathematical models and quantitative methods.

To perform content analysis, the most important technique is on the algorithm of machine learning. To complete a well-developed algorithm, it is important to use daily information around the analysis topic. After well-consideration about the features needs to extract, we can make a well performance program for content analysis. Thus, human and computer need to be well       co-operate.

As what you say in your blog,  both human and machine techniques has advantages and disadvantages. And there is one thing I think we should pay attention to. Qualitative analysis by human doesn’t mean human should analyze by their deep subjective understanding. It’s the techniques which is reshaped based on counts and connections.
Maybe we can mining some value and real information through comment mining, to avoid the false or glorified information, such as box-office income.

articles.title: Content analysis

articles.content: In the lecture six, we still learnt sentiment analysis and opinion mining, at the latter part of the lecture, the handling negation is slightly mentioned. I think it is a very important part in sentiment analysis, because of some sentiment shifters, which are words and phrases that can change sentiment orientations.In some simple situations, the sentiment shifters are just before the opinion words, sometimes the sentiment shifters are some far away from opinion words, like “I don’t think the camera’s color is the best one.” So the method treating the sentiment shifters like “don’t” as the mark, and when there are odd marks in one sentence, the opinion word is judged as its opposite; while the opinion is judged as it original meaning when there are even marks. But there still many unexpected situations in sentiment analysis and opinion mining, so we should treat every sentences carefully.

comments.content: Your point is reasonable but it seems time costly. Imagine there are millions of articles to process. Certainly doing in such way would be a nightmare.

I quite agree with your point of view. In Chinese, many meaning of the sentence may produces a completely different meaning because of a word , even the punctuation, different punctuation will express the opposite meaning, such as “It’s a nice dress." And “It’s a nice dress?" , they express completely different meaning.

I agree with the negation problem you mentioned in the blog.  Sentiment shifters, not handled properly, will produce some misleading results, like regarding a negative sentence as positive one. As sentiment analysis based on natural language processing, people have different ways when using language expressing themselves, just as you have said, they can add sentiment shifters right before opinion words or far away from them. So it’s quite important to handle negation carefully to make sure a correct result.

I couldn’t agree more. That’s just what I was thinking. Human language is very complex, sometimes even humanbeing may misunderstanding a sentence, not mention to the machines. So it is very difficult to train machine to fully understand human language, especially to deal with negaation. What’s more, handling negation carefully can help improve the accuracy of sentiment analysis.

The negation and sarcasm or irony you mentioned in last blog are such big issues when dealing with the enrich natural languages.  Even one punctuation can make the sentence opposite in meaning. That make the opinion mining harder. We have to deal with the special words like “not","almost" ,and detect the context of that word collected, as well as the word itself.

According to the text size, sentiment analysis can often be divided into three research topics: Word-level Sentiment Analysis(WSA), Sentence-level Sentiment Analysis(SSA) and Document-level Sentiment Analysis(DSA). More and more people realised that a certain word may represent distinct meanings in different co-text. So many models such as SVM, Maximum Entropy(ME), Conditional Random Fields(CRFs) ,etc. are used currently on text-based emotion detection.

articles.title: Some Opinions about Handling Negation

articles.content: As mentioned in lecture5, there will be some sarcasms and ironies in an opinion, which can cause some inaccurate classify.To deal with these saturations, we can let the classifier take the rate made by the opinion holders. If the rate is low, but there are some “very good” words in the opinion, such as “excellent”, “amazing”, “outstanding”, then we can conclude that the opinion is so called sarcasm or irony. Another method can be compare with other opinions, if the opinion show positive estimate while most of other opinions show negative estimate, it could be a sarcasm or irony.And one more thing, a sarcasm or irony is usually appear when the entity is “so bad” on some aspects.

comments.content: I agree with your idea and I think that the a sarcasm existed should be companied with more restrictions. For example, the number of the commenters should be large enough, or maybe the comments made by same person should issue several words.
NB classifier’s concept of using probability can partly deal with the problem you mention.

Ironically is indeed a big challenge for sentiment analysis, because the traditional methods of analysis may only analyze the original meaning of words. But the language is so interesting, a word may exhibit the opposite meaning in its language environment. This will greatly enhance the difficulty of sentiment analysis.

articles.title: Difficulty in achieving accurate sentiment analysis

articles.content: As we have learnt the Naïve Bayes Text Classification in Lecture3, I find it is a very primary, just like its name with “Naïve”.It will arbitrarily judge the probability that a document is belonging to a class as 0, as long as there is a word of the document which is not belonging to this class in the training set, even the document has 99% the same word as one of the document in the training set.Then a method called “add-one smoothing” is illustrated,where B is Total number of unique words in all documents, but it still naïve.It just avoid the appearance 0, but still give the probability in a very low value.Although the Naïve Bayes Text Classification is not such correct, it is still a great since it play a role as one of the text classification’s base.

According to the simplicity of the naive bayes classification algorithm, we can find that it is very easy to be understood but cannot be applied in the very complex and complicated  cases. It cannot provide a very powerful and accurate classification results when the target circumstances become very complicated.

articles.title: Some idea about Naive Bayes Text Classification

articles.title: Term2:Emojis in Sentiment Analysis

articles.content: Many websites use rating score to express the degree of preference from cyber citizens, like DaZhongDianPing in restaurant and Douban in music or film. But is it a trustworthy attribute to measure things good or bad?the first interference is secret operations from merchant or advertiser, pay money and get high ranking. Or just like professor mentioned –‘水军’.the second interference is group pressure or herd behavior. Not only people’s choice will affect by rating and comments, but also the judgement from new reviewer will influence by the older ranking.For example in Douban film, we can find just a few new film on the top ranking. The new comer hard to get a score larger than 9. Before a new reviewer give his score to a film he like, and find many 5 stars ranked. Most of us will follow other’s decision – give a 5 stars.But, if the average rate is 3.5, we will give a higher score than average but few of us will give a 5 stars. So that’s why many old film got a high score on Douban, because there are many old rating and comments in high score influence our decision.
articles.title: Term2:The interference of score rating

In NB the probability of a document both have A and B is 0.5×0.5=0.25, but everyone can find this is impossibility.
articles.title: Term2:About Naive Bayes Classification

articles.content: To implement sentiment analysis, we should identify the entity, aspect, opinion holder, time and sentiment from a given opinion document.There are few ways to extract aspect, the basic ways are:1)Frequent nouns and noun phrases. Aspects are usually nouns, so we can use POS Taggers to identify those words and keep the frequent ones.2)Opinion and target relations. Sometimes, a sentence has some sentiment words but does not have any frequent nouns, then the nearest noun can be considered as the aspect.There are some other methods that can help, such as supervised learning, topic modeling.

comments.content: Extract nouns and noun phrases is a good way, so that we can identify what the user concerned , but the sentiment analysis also need to get the emotional reaction from users, this is relatively complicated, but it is also very necessary, after all we need to find the user’s preferences and habits.

To analyse text content, it is true that we need to classify the phrases first. Based on frequency counting, we may find some important word. Also we need to find to object described by it. Moreover, we can locate some critical words, such as conjunction, like but, nor, and also connective, like however, These words can express negation feeling or indicating important message at those sentences.

You list the steps and methods of  sentiment analysis, including the identification and extraction. They are all important in social analysis, although we have more methods to do these analysis. But if we want to achieve our analysis purposes, they are far from enough.

articles.title: Sentiment Analysis and Opinion Mining

articles.content: With sentiment analysis and opinion mining system, we can make use of the reviews of people to help make a decision on what to buy. Unfortunately, there are few people who post fake reviews to promote or depreciate some products or services, which is called opinion spamming. Opinion spamming has really bad influence on the correctness of the sentiment analysis.As a result, it is important to detect these fake reviews. Unlike typical machine learning, we have no labelled training, so we have to explore the characteristics of opinion spamming and spammers to find some patterns.Usually, duplicates imply fake reviews. We can filter some fake reviews by detecting duplicates from different user-ids on the same product, same user-id on different products or different user-ids on different products.Finding fake reviewers or spammers will also help. Gmail detect spamming in this way.Atypical behaviors can also imply opinion spam. If all other reviewers praised one brand, but one reviewer wrote all negative reviews for that and praise a competing brand, then we can consider it as a fake review.

comments.content: I think the method to filter fake reviews you mentioned in this blog sounds good. And it can be really helpful to us if there is a tool that can filter fake reviews when shopping online. articles.title: Spam Detection

articles.content: Text classification is a typical example of supervised learning, in which we analyze the labelled training data and classify the items into some predetermined categories based on features. The major issues to consider is how to design the function and how much training data we need and the dimensionality of the input space. We also have to consider the noise caused by human error or sensor error. Naïve Bayes, SVM (support vector machines), decision tree learning are typical supervised learning algorithm. Supervised learning is widely applied in our life, e.g. handwriting recognition, information retrieval, pattern recognition, etc.Text clustering is an example of unsupervised learning, in this case, we make use of unlabeled data, cluster based on similarity. There is no error or reward signal to evaluate and no need to have a training set. Typical approaches includes K-means, EM (expectation-maximization algorithm), etc. Topic modeling and  text clustering are also typical applications of unsupervised learning.

comments.content: I quite agree with your opinions. The process of Supervised learning is very similar to way humans learn new things. We can use training data to get an optimal model to deal with new datas and inputs. However, unsupervised learning without training data, we have to establish the model directly according to some characteristics.

articles.title: Supervised and Unsupervised Learning

articles.content: There are two points to analyze the centrality of social network: centralization and centrality. Centralization represent the attribution about the single point in the network while centrality show the attribution of the whole graph of the network.There are four analysis methods of centrality: degree centrality, betweenness centrality, closeness centrality, eigenvector centrality. In addition, every method have degree and potential index.Degree centrality means that if a point has a lot of indirect relatives in the social network, the point is in the central. It uses in-degree and out-degree to represent the DC, the in-degree is regarded as the degree of popularity and the out-degree is the degree of gregarious.Betweenness centrality is the number of the shortest path. Closeness centrality is the degree of dependence of a point to other point. Eigenvector centrality is based on the relative index, the connection of high index point is more important than the low index point.

comments.content: Through your article, we knew a lot of basic concepts in social analysis, including centrality and the analysis methods. Both degree centrality and betweenness centrality are meaningful in social analysis, we still have a long way to go about how to use them to analysis social media to achieve out purposes.

These four analysis methods of centrality are very important in social network analysis area. However, all of them are not perfect and they all have their own advantages and disadvantages.For example, the method of degree centrality is simple and intuitive but it only reflects the local features of nodes. And for the method of betweenness centrality, it’s not suitable for large network.

Yes, we have done some practices about the degree centrality, betweenness centrality and closeness centrality which have their own formula according to the direction. Plus, we can do these analysis based on the certain graph means we have to desperate the big graph into several small clusters. So considering handling huge data, it is better to use other algorithms like “Dijkstra’s algorithm”, another classmate recommended, to calculate the shortest path like the closeness centrality algorithm did.

articles.title: The centrality of social network

articles.content: NLP (natural language processing) is an important direction of the fields of computer science and artificial intelligence. It involves computer science, mathematics, linguistics and concentrates on the interactions between computers and human languages. Computer can understand the natural language and switch the computer data to the natural language by using the NLP.The processes of NLP includes pre-processing(clear the data), tokenization(break the text to words), normalization(convert words to lowercases), stemming(find the root of the words), POS(divide words to content or function words by adding tags), language modelling(predict the next appearing words by capturing the characteristics of a language).There are some technological difficulties: we can only analysis an individual sentence without considering the context；understanding a sentence need many relative knowledge, so it is important to enlarge the storage of knowledge.

comments.content: Computers are extremely good at manipulating syntax, but they are extremely weak at manipulating concepts. As a matter of fact, a concept is totally stranger to computer processes. However, natural language is all about concepts and it only uses syntax as a transient means to get to it.

NLP that you described has a special significance in the field of artificial intelligence. Imagining that humans can communicate with computers  through specific language, how interesting it will be, and it will completely change our lives.

The process of NLP you described is quite comprehensive. As NLP includes so many process, it sounds quite difficult. However, NLP is so useful that it makes computers understand what people say and further know what they think. Interacting with computers as the way interacting with humans sounds like science fiction, but with artificial intelligence, it can be achievable.

As for the technological difficulties in your last paragraph, i read other’s blogs recently, some student of us express the same worry as  what you mentioned. They raised questions about whether sentiment analysis deal with irony and how to handle negation. As sentiment analysis based on natural language processing, there indeed existed difficulties to make sure a correct result. l hope the problem can be solved in the future.

With the accumulation of big data corpus, the technology of NLP changes a lot. More and more big technology companies see the potential value of NLP and expand their business scope in the field of NLP research. I think in the future, NLP will be applied to many areas and maybe can change the way we live.

articles.title: AN INTRODUCTION OF NLP

articles.content: In general, currently there are three main methods for sentiment classification, machine learning-based approach, lexicon-based approach, and a hybrid of machine learning-based and lexicon-based approach.Machine learning-based approach mainly contains supervised learning and unsupervised learning. For supervised learning, the main task is to train a classifier from training data with labels, and then the classifier is used to determine labels for new examples. The main difference between supervised and unsupervised learning is that no labels are provided for unsupervised learning, and thus the evaluation of a solution is not applicable.Lexicon-based approach contains dictionary-based approach and corpus-based approach. These two approaches determine the sentiment by checking the opinions words appeared.

comments.content: I notice that you mention the main difference of the supervised and unsupervised learning is whether there is a label. I think a label is easy for a “supervisor” to manage and classify the words, but at the same time, we will lose some information when labelling others (may be it’s inevitable?). Haha, and we all know that supervised and unsupervised learning have their own dis- or advantages, right?

articles.title: Main Methods for Sentiment Classification

articles.content: Generally speaking, Sentiment Analysis, also known as Opinion Mining, is the process of extracting subjective content from digital text automatically, and determining whether the expressed or implied sentiment is positive, or negative by using natural language processing, text analysis, and computational linguistics. It aims at determining the attitude or opinion of the opinion holder about a particular entity (such as a product, a topic, a service, etc.).Polarity of words are highly depended upon in current tools and algorithms. However, the words may mean totally oppositely in a different sentence context. What’s worse, sarcasms and ironies can make it extremely difficult for current models to determine the sentiment. Therefore, the analysis accuracy would drop under those circumstances.
articles.title: A Brief Introduction of Sentiment Analysis

articles.content: Natural Language Processing (NLP), as a type of artificial intelligence (AI), generally enables computers to understand and generate human natural language. Common core tasks involved in NLP include pre-processing, tokenization, sentence segmentation, part-of-speech tagging, language modelling, clustering, text classification and sentiment analysis.The core of NLP is to teach computers to understand how humans learn and use language, and thus NLP is based on machine learning. This technique allows computer programs to improve themselves automatically when encountering new data. As a result, instead of traditionally human communicating with computers in a programing language, with NLP computers can analyze and understand human speeches easily, even the different meanings of the same word or sentence in different contexts.
articles.title: A Brief Introduction of Natural Language Processing

articles.content: Recently, I have learned definition of social network and why we need to analyze social network. Social network can be devided into explicit social network and implicit social network. We can use graph to represent relationship in social network. Graph has three important concepts: Degree  centrality, betweenness centrality and closeness centrality. Betweenness centrality is used to measure the importance of an actor in a social network. There are two dimensions for information flow processes in a social network: transmission dimension and trajectory dimension. The transmission dimension distinguishes whether diffusion occurs via transfer or replication. The trajectory dimension concerns whether the traffic flows non-deterministically.We use graph clustering to detect communities in social network. In last semester, I have learned a lot of knowledge in machine learning, so in this course I will apply the knowledge to solve practical problems.

articles.content: Content analysis is a broad term that sums up nearly every analytical technique that can be used to extract secondary meaning from information. Content analysis has the advantage of the following aspects:(1) Content analysis is a disciplined approach, the definition of categories and operating rules are very clear and comprehensive.(2) Content analysis belongs to structured research，the biggest advantage of structured is easy to quantify and statistic analysis, easy to use computer simulation and data processing.(3) Content analysis is not man-made object but the object with things, there is no interaction between the researchers and the things being studied, so that the sampling and measurement errors can be canceled.(4) Content analysis can reveal the nature of the contents of document

As you mentioned, content analysis has various aspects in both traditional printed publications and new situations like broadcast media, live situations ,etc. Usually, content analysis includes six processes: selecting contents, uniting contents, preparing for coding, coding, counting & weighting and drawing the conclusions. For a media organisation, content analysis is often used for evaluating and improving the programmes.

Yes, just like you mentioned, content analysis is very useful to do varies studies. However, although it has so many advantages, it still has some limitations. For example, content analysis sometimes is extremely time consuming and it often disregards the context that produced the text, as well as the state of things after the text is produced. Thus, I think content analysis is a tool for us to do some research but we can not fully rely on it.

articles.title: Social Analytic & Machine Learning

articles.content: A sample usage at the real-life of Entropy Centrality.First, we define the phenomena to study, ranging from molecular systems composed by single/multiple/macro- molecules to ecological systems or social systems. Second, we collect several cases from literature. Next, we classify the cases in at least two different groups (e.g:active/nonactive). After that, we represent the interconnectivity of the discrete parts of the system as a graph or network. The Markov Chain theory is used to calculate the entropy of the system for nodes placed at different distances. Finally, we aim to both derive and validate a classification model using the entropy values as input variables and the classification of cases as the output variables.

comments.content: The model is used to predict the probability with which a case presents the studied property. The present work proposes the entropy of a Markov Chain associated with a network or graph to be used as a universal quantity in pattern recognition regardless what nature of the systems are under studying.

articles.title: Similarity of Documents

articles.content: Centrality is the identification of importance of vertices in a graph or social network. There are various kinds of centrality:In-degree/Out-degree centrality measures the importance of vertices simply based on their in-degree/out-degree. An important application of in-degree centrality is to measure the truthfulness of a webpage. (PageRank)Closeness centrality of a vertex is the inverse of the summation of shortest distance from this vertex to all other vertices. It can be used in genealogy construction.Entropy centrality is characterized by path-based transfer flows. It measures the distribution of the probabilities that the flow stops at each of the vertices in the network. Centrality is low when the choices of flows are highly constrained and vice versa.

comments.content: It seems like you’ve comprehended the meaning of centrality in social media analysis and if you have interest in how to calculate the degree or more centrality of nodes in social network you’re recommended to read notes of ‘social network analysis’ at last semester. They are included more measurements of social network and their practical meanings. For example, betweenness centrality of nodes means how important it is in the whole network.

articles.content: Naive Bayes Text Classification is a probabilistic learning method. The probability of a document d being in class c is computed asAnd P(t | c) is defined as follow to avoid zero probabilities assigned to unseen word-class relations: As we can see, although Naive Bayes Text Classification involves the concept of Bayes’ formula, it is not a rigorous probability calculation. articles.title: Naive Bayes Text Classification

articles.content: K-mean clustering is a useful technique to classify documents according to their text similarity. The goal of K-mean clustering is to find K points (centroids) in the item space that represent the K clusters of items. Detailed algorithm is as follow:Step 1: Apply the initial random clustering on the data to come up with K centroids.Step 2: Calculate the means of each of the clusters.Step 3: Each data point is examined and assigned to the closest cluster represented by its associated mean.By taking several iterations of the step 2 and step 3, the data set is trained and clustering finally has converged.The following chart simulates the clustering steps. (With K =3)

articles.content: On the web, you can find many numbers comparing the adoption and popularity of R and Python. While these figures often give a good indication on how these two languages are evolving in the overall ecosystem of computer science, it’s hard to compare them side-by-side.The main reason for this is that you will find R only in a data science environment; As a general purpose language, Python, on the other hand, is widely used in many fields, such as web development. This often biases the ranking results in favor of Python, while the salaries are affected somewhat negatively.R is mainly used when the data analysis task requires standalone computing or analysis on individual servers. It’s great for exploratory work, and it’s handy for almost any type of data analysis because of the huge number of packages.You can use Python when your data analysis tasks need to be integrated with web apps or if statistics code needs to be incorporated into a production database. Being a fully fledged programming language, it’s a great tool to implement algorithms for production use.

articles.title: Framework Of Sentiment Analysis On  Social Media Data

articles.content:
Any classification rule needs to be evaluated for its performance on the future samples. It is almost never the case in microarray studies that a large independent
population-based collection of samples is available at the time of initial classifier-building phase.
One needs to estimate future performance based on what is available: often the same set that is used to build the classifier.
Assessing performance of the classifier based on Cross-validation.,Test set,Independent testing on  future dataset.
Resubstitution estimation: error rate on the learning set, Problem is the downward bias.To do the test set estimation,first we need to divide learning set into two sub-sets, L and T; Build the classifier on L and compute the error rate on T. Second, We Build the classifier on the training set (L) and compute the error rate on an independent test set (T).V-fold cross-validation (CV) estimation: Cases in learning set randomly divided into V subsets of (nearly) equal size.Build classifiers by leaving one set out; compute test set
error rates on the left out set and averaged.Leave-one-out cross validation (LOOCV).(Special case for V=n). Works well for stable classifiers (kNN,LOOCV)

articles.title: Performance assessment

articles.content: Sentiment analysis is that using NLP, statistics, or machine learning methods to extract , identify or otherwise characterize the sentiment content of a text unit. It sometimes refers to as opinion mining.Existing approaches to sentiment analysis can be grouped into three main categories: knowledge-based techniques, statistical methods, and hybrid approach.Knowledge-based techniques classify text by affect categories based on the presence of unambiguous affect words such as happy, sad , afraid and bored. Some knowledge bases not only list obvious affect words, but also assign arbitrary words a probable “affinity” to particular emotions. Statistical methods classify based on machine learning approaches such as decision tree classifier,support vector machines,neural network and naive bayes. Hybrid approaches leverage on both machine learning and elements from knowledge representation in order to detect  semantics  that are expressed in a subtle manner.

articles.title: Sentiment Analysis

articles.content: The decision tree will build a model based on the training dataset as soon as the training dataset is available. It is an example of eager learner. The model is then applied to testing dataset for prediction. Decision tree can be applied to data sets that have many attributes and the results are more readable. An opposite strategy is not to build a model from the training dataset; but make prediction using the training dataset when a testing record is available. It is an example of lazy learner. K-nearest  neighbor (knn) and naive Bayes (NB) classifiers are examples of lazy learner. The k-Nearest Neighbor mainly depend on the surrounding adjacent samples,and we can adopt the weighting method(The smaller of the distance, the larger of the weight) to improve. Also the calculation amount of KNN is large.Naive Bayes model originated from the classical mathematics theory, it has a solid mathematical foundation, and the clsaaification efficiency of NB is stable. For Naive Bayes,we need to know the priori probability.

articles.content: When we use gephi to do the clustering, we could see that there is one famous clustering method that we are actually not familiar with it, called Markov Cluster Algorithm (MCL). So what is MCL. Well,  as we all know, we could divide machine learning into four classes, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, semi-supervised learning and reinforcement learning. So MCL,  is actually a fast unsupervised clustering algorithm, which mainly based on Random Walk and Markov chain. The main idea of MCL is to random walk one point, and then when the cluster become dense, the walking point would not leave the cluster easily. So the first part of MCL is the ordinary random walk, the second part of MCL is actually based on the characteristics of no following effects in the Markov Chain. Backwardly, MCL is actually amending one transition probability matrix performing Expansion and Inflation. The main focus of these two performing is to make the neighbor points connect to each other stronger, thus to form a cluster.
articles.title: What is Markov Cluster Algorithm (MCL)?

articles.content: There are a lot of graphs when we do the researches about social network analysis. So basically we just can’t skip the algorithm of graph theory, especially when we really want to know the establish of social networking. So generally speaking ,there are four easy and most famous algorithms in graph theory, Minimum Spanning Tree algorithm Dijkstra algorithm, Topological Order algorithm, and Critical Path Method. Minimum Spanning Tree algorithm,  basically speaking, finds the minimum of the total sum of weights in an undirected graph. Dijkstra algorithm, is one algorithm finding the minimum distinction from one point to another point in a graph. Topological Order algorithm is a little hard to understand, since it contains basic knowledge of topology. What it perform is to list all the points by a linear order  in a Directed Acyclic Graph. Critical Path Method is a practical algorithm created by DuPont chemistry company. What it mainly concerns about is how much time is one specific project cost, and those key activities in it, which generally combines Dijkstra algorithm with Topological Order algorithm, to make the whole project performs in a short time and efficiently.

articles.title: One Con of Sentiment Analysis

articles.content: At the lecture last two week, we have saw several different Centrality methods of social network analysis, which mainly used to measure the relative importance of an nodes in a social network.Most of the centrality measures possess one of two properties: either parallel duplication or the importance of geodesics. We commonly use Degree centrality, Betweenness centrality and Closeness centrality to index the nodes’ activity, measure the nodes’ control and they communicational efficiency to know their centrality.Another important method is to compute the entropy of each nodes to measure the importance of it. Instead of finding the importance of geodesics of each nodes,we assume a information flow start from a specific node, then summary the probability that the flow stop at each node to get their centrality. If there is much freedom of choice to go through the next adjacent nodes, this node would be thought to have high centrality. The peak value of centrality of a node appear when the probability to travel to the next nodes are equal and its go with increasing N.Through running these centrality measurement on social network, we can find out the important actors from the complex network and understand much clearly about how the social network works.

comments.content: I would like to know when entropy measurement can outperform the other measurements like betweenness ?

articles.title: Social Network Analysis – Centrality

articles.content: The main methods of sentiment classification are machine learning approach and Lexicon approach.For machine learning, we mainly use supervised approach to do sentiment analyze. Some documents which we know their sentiment class are used to train the dictionary. Then handle the sentiment as the text classification to find out the polarity of the sentiment.Similar to machine learning approach, Lexicon approach also classify the sentiment as polarity detection, but the way we construct the dictionary is different. In Dictionary-based Approach, one of the main methods of Lexicon approach, construct the dictionary with the word that their orientation have been known and predict the polarity of the sentiment with average ‘sentiment score’ of opinion words of the sentiment . In Corpus-based approach, we use the dictionary which contain known words with their polarity to determined the polarity of the unknown words by computing the similarity between them. Doing the statistics of the words’ polarity, we can find out the polarity of this sentiment.

comments.content: In your blog you mention that “For machine learning, some documents which we know their sentiment class are used to train the dictionary." and “In Lexicon approach, the way we construct the dictionary is different. " So the difference is that one is with scores and the other is not?

articles.content: Social media analytics extract and summarize information from social media and do analysis to understand and predict people’s opinions, preference, behaviors and more others thing.Content analysis mainly contain Vocabulary Analysis, which use work histogram to compute the frequency of words, use Normative Comparison to summary the trends of usage of words and use Non-word Analysis to mine the further emotional cues imparted by some vocabulary cues (ORZ etc.).The others important analysis is Natural Language Processing. NLP contain Pre-processing, tokenization, normalization, stemming, part of speech. First, NLP do Pre-processing to clean the input data, deleted useless information (e.g. stop words/emoticons). Then NLP also finish tokenization, normalization, stemming respectively to break up the raw text into words  and then get the ‘root’ and Truecasing word for further analysis.With these basic analysis methods, we fundamentally summary some feature of the document and others data source. For further analysis, we can also use machine learning to processing the data and get different result.

articles.content: Here is a good practice example of sentiment analysis.Assuming that you want to watch a movie but you do not want to waste time on bad movies. Friends of you recommended websites of movie reviews for you to decide which recent showing movies may be your favorite. However, there are tens of movies and each of them, has several reviews by different author. Certainly it’s not possible to go through all these.One solution is letting computer programs do the reading for you. Here comes the application of sentiment analysis: let programs learn the attitude of the authors. To be specific, sentiment analysis is a multi-class classification problem. Classes include positive, negative or neutral etc.As listed in lecture notes, one of the straightforward way is to turn one passage into a bag of words, a vector of true/false. After turning samples into features, NB classifier, SVM, decision trees can be applied easily, as other classification tasks.

Movie recommendation is a typical application of recommendation systems. In the era of big data, recommendation system is a meaningful technique to solve the problem named “information-overload” so that people can gain the useful information they want. Sentiment analysis is exactly the fundamental procedure for the following process of recommendation methods such as Collaborative Filtering Recommendation, which is the main approach we widely use.

articles.content: After learning the very basic concepts of machine learning, I’ve concluded them as followings.Machine learning is the design of software that allowing the computer to learn from experience, discovering the data pattern and finally, making decision. More specifically, Tom Mitchell defined it as “A program can be said to learn from experience E with respect to some class of tasks T and performance measure P, if its performance at tasks in T, as measured by P, improves with experience E”. To be consistent with text book, output will be referred as response variable, input as features.The experience mentioned above includes supervised, unsupervised and in some cases, semi-supervised. The former means that the experience consists of input and its corresponding output. The latter implies that the program would have to find patterns from unlabeled input. The final is a mixture of the two.

articles.content: There are two main types of machine learning – supervised learning and unsupervised learning. Different from the supervised learning (text classification), the clustering is based on the similarity of objects. And the text clustering has no predefined categories so that there is no training set.The result of clustering can be ‘hard’ of ‘soft’. In a hard result each object only belongs to one cluster and in soft result each object can belong to many clusters. In the lecture we performed a game making use of K-Means clustering when K=3. It is easy to find that the clustering result is different from the text classification result in the sense that we should further assign meanings to the clusters otherwise they are meaningless.

comments.content: K-Means clustering is a simpler way for differentiate the data in different group based on similarity between data. The most important part is how to extract features for comparison and find a suitable K value.

articles.content: In a word, it assumes the independence between features, which is mentioned in the lecture note.For a given database, it firstly learns the joint distribution of input/output based on feature conditional independence.  And for a given input x, we can use the Bayes theorem to get an output y.For example, we have two words— A and B. According to the assumption of Naïve Bayes classifier, if we know that whether word A is in a message or not we still don’t know the probability that word B will appear in this message.  As it’s so extreme, we call it “Naïve”.
articles.title: What is the difference between “Naïve” Bayes classifier and other common Bayes classifier?

We’ve learnt some basic knowledge of NLP and  some
processing methods of it. As an understanding, NLP is regarded as a part of AI. In computers’ world, it’s easy for them to process a large amount of words in a very short time comparing to human being. But they will do this in a “uniform” way—if we have the same input we will always get the same output. what we should do is to using the NLP to “teach” the machines to process the worlds in different ways inder different conditions and situations. After that, the machine can “understand” the meaning of the words and we finally realize the human-computer interaction.
